resource.chars:
except as affording a presumption that the author 
had not made himself so much acquainted 
with what is known on the subject of his 
paper, as an enquirer in any branch of 
Science is absolutely bound to render himself.
Of the third part I would merely observe 
that the theoretical considerations,
based moreover as I conceive them to be 
upon false premises, are in themselves 
far too vague and unsatisfactory to be 
of any utility whatever. Like the former 
part of the paper, also, they betray such 
an ignorance of or such an inattention 
to the observations of previous writers 
as on that account alone, to be in my 
opinion quite inadmissible in a 
philosophical paper.
